metadata.title: CVE-2021-2144 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Parser). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.29 and priorand 8.0.19 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in takeover of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 7.2(Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mariadb-10.1 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
